intro: Cheilanthes thellungii, commonly known as the rock fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its compact, evergreen fronds that are typically gray-green in color. This plant thrives in rocky, arid environments and is often found growing on limestone or sandstone. Its rhizomes are thick and fibrous, allowing it to anchor itself in crevices. Cheilanthes thellungii is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient and hardy plant species.
